awd_abstract_narration: This award will provide one-half of the funds needed to                    acquire an X-ray diffraction spectrometer system for installation               and operation by the Department of Geology at the State                         University of New York in Buffalo. The University is committed to               providing the other half of the funds required.                                      X-ray diffraction is a fundamental technique for the study                 of the molecular structure and the properties of solid,                         crystalline materials. The instrument will be primarily used for                research on the defect structures of clay minerals, especially                  kaolinites, which have commercial as well as geological value.                  The new equipment will also be made available to qualified                      researchers in the departments of Chemistry and Engineering.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
